ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Automating the process of finding security vulnerabilities and gathering information through Google Dorking for cybersecurity professionals.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Automated Google Dorking â€¢ LLM Integration (OpenAI, Anthropic, Gemini) â€¢ API Key Management (.env file) â€¢ Customizable search result count and time duration â€¢ Dynamic model selection at runtime
ðŸ“– Summary: DorkAgent is an LLM-powered Python tool designed to automate Google Dorking for bug hunting and penetration testing. It leverages AI models and search engine APIs to discover vulnerabilities and gather intelligence.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

âœ¨ WEF | Shell
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Analyzing and exploiting vulnerabilities in Wi-Fi networks for security testing.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ WPA/WPA2/WPA3, WPS, WEP, Rogue-AP, and Handshake Attacks â€¢ Automatic attack mode based on AP features â€¢ Automatic handshake capture â€¢ Online and offline handshake cracking â€¢ Simple login template for Evil Twin attack
ðŸ“– Summary: The WEF (Wi-Fi Exploitation Framework) is a shell-based tool designed for security researchers and penetration testers. It automates and facilitates the analysis and exploitation of vulnerabilities in WPA/WPA2, WPS, and WEP Wi-Fi networks, supporting both 2.4 GHz and 5 GHz bands.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸš€ copyparty | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: To easily set up a file server on almost any device, accessible via multiple protocols and a web browser, with robust upload and download capabilities.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Portable file server â€¢ Accelerated resumable uploads/downloads â€¢ Deduplication â€¢ Multiple protocols: HTTP(S), WebDAV, SFTP, FTP(S), TFTP, SMB/CIFS â€¢ Media indexer with thumbnails
ðŸ“– Summary: Copyparty is a versatile, portable file server that supports multiple protocols including HTTP, WebDAV, SFTP, FTP, and TFTP. It excels at accelerated, resumable uploads and downloads, deduplication, and offers features like media indexing and thumbnail generation, all runnable with just Python.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸš€ Uscrapper | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Data extraction and intelligence gathering from the surface and deep web, including dark web sources, with a focus on personal information and keyword-specific data.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Dark Web Support (.onion links) â€¢ Keyword-Based Scraping â€¢ Extraction of Email Addresses, Social Media Links, Author Names, Geolocations, Phone Numbers, Usernames
ðŸ“– Summary: Uscrapper Vanta is an open-source Python tool designed for comprehensive web scraping, capable of extracting various data points from both the surface and deep web. It leverages multithreading and advanced anti-scraping defenses to gather information like email addresses, social media links, and geolocations, with new support for dark web (.onion) links and keyword-based scraping.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸš€ VKGroupParser | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Automated collection and filtering of VKontakte content for analysis or archival, with remote management capabilities.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ VKontakte post and comment parsing â€¢ Keyword filtering with fuzzy matching and spell checking â€¢ Data storage in MongoDB â€¢ Telegram bot for remote control
ðŸ“– Summary: This Python repository is designed to parse posts and comments from VKontakte, filter them by keywords using fuzzy matching and spell checking, and store the results in a MongoDB database. It also includes a Telegram bot for remote management and control.
